Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats, one on land (like a playground or forest) and one in water (like a pond or lake).
The student can include various living things in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, and flowers for land habitats, or fish and clams for water habitats.
The student can show the differences in plant and animal life between the two habitats by including at least three different plants or animals in each drawing.
The student can use their drawings to indicate patterns, showing how certain plants and animals are found in specific habitats.
The student can organize their drawing to clearly present the data of the different types of plants and animals observed in each habitat.
